sections.heading: What is To-conditional?
sections.content:
と-conditional expresses automatic, inevitable, or habitual results. When A happens, B always/naturally happens.

押すと、開く "When you push, it opens" (automatic result) 春になると、桜が咲く "When spring comes, cherry blossoms bloom" (natural/habitual)

sections.heading: How to Form To-conditional
sections.content:
Simple rule: Dictionary form + と

食べる + と → 食べると (when eat) 行く + と → 行くと (when go) する + と → すると (when do)

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content: 食べる → 食べると (when eat) 見る → 見ると (when see) 寝る → 寝ると (when sleep) 起きる → 起きると (when wake up)

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content: 書く → 書くと (when write) 読む → 読むと (when read) 話す → 話すと (when speak) 買う → 買うと (when buy) 行く → 行くと (when go)

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → すると (when do) 来る → 来ると (くると, kuruto) (when come)

sections.heading: Negative To-conditional
sections.content:
Use ないと :

食べる → 食べないと (when don't eat) 行く → 行かないと (when don't go) する → しないと (when don't do)

children.heading: 1. Automatic/Natural Results
children.content: このボタンを押すと、電気がつく "When you press this button, the light turns on" (automatic) 水を熱すると、沸騰する "When you heat water, it boils" (natural law) 右に曲がると、駅がある "When you turn right, there's the station" (fixed location)

children.heading: 2. Habitual Actions
children.content: 朝起きると、コーヒーを飲む "When I wake up in the morning, I drink coffee" (habit) 家に帰ると、すぐシャワーを浴びる "When I get home, I immediately take a shower" (routine)

children.heading: 3. General Truths
children.content: 冬になると、寒くなる "When winter comes, it gets cold" 春になると、花が咲く "When spring comes, flowers bloom" 夜になると、暗くなる "When night comes, it gets dark"

children.heading: 4. Discovery/Realization
children.content: 見ると、友達だった "When I looked, it was my friend" 聞くと、彼は日本人だった "When I asked, he was Japanese"

sections.heading: When to Use と
sections.content:
Use と when:

Result is automatic Result is inevitable Habitual/repeated action General truth Scientific fact Fixed sequence

sections.heading: と vs Other Conditionals
sections.content: | Form | Usage | Example | | ---- | ------------------ | --------------------------- | | と | Automatic result | 押すと開く (natural) | | たら | Specific condition | 押したら開いた (discovery) | | ば | General condition | 押せば開く (if push) | | なら | Topic condition | 押すなら (if going to push) |

children.heading: Comparison Examples
children.content: と: 春になると、桜が咲く "When spring comes, cherry blossoms bloom" (always happens, natural) たら: 春になったら、お花見に行こう "When spring comes, let's go flower viewing" (specific plan) ば: 春になれば、暖かくなる "When spring comes, it gets warm" (general condition)

children.heading: Directions
children.content: まっすぐ行くと、駅がある "When you go straight, there's the station" 右に曲がると、郵便局が見える "When you turn right, you can see the post office" この道を行くと、学校に着く "When you go down this road, you arrive at school"

children.heading: Cause and Effect
children.content: たくさん食べると、太る "When you eat a lot, you gain weight" 勉強しないと、失敗する "If you don't study, you'll fail" 運動すると、健康になる "When you exercise, you become healthy"

children.heading: Instructions/Warnings
children.content: このボタンを押すと、始まる "When you press this button, it starts" ここを触ると、危ない "When you touch here, it's dangerous" このスイッチを入れると、動く "When you flip this switch, it moves"

sections.heading: と with Time Expressions
sections.content: 3時になると、店が閉まる "When it becomes 3 o'clock, the store closes" 夏になると、暑くなる "When summer comes, it gets hot" 夜になると、静かになる "When night comes, it gets quiet"

children.heading: 1. Volitional Actions in Result Clause
children.content: Wrong: 雨が降ると、傘を持って行く ❌ Right: 雨が降ったら、傘を持って行く ✓ "If it rains, I'll bring an umbrella" (volitional action = use たら)

children.heading: 2. Commands/Requests
children.content: Wrong: 家に着くと、電話してください ❌ Right: 家に着いたら、電話してください ✓ "When you get home, please call"

children.heading: 3. Past Tense in Result
children.content: Wrong: 開けると、空だった ❌ Right: 開けたら、空だった ✓ "When I opened it, it was empty"

children.heading: い-adjectives
children.content: 暑い + と → 暑いと "when it's hot" 寒い + と → 寒いと "when it's cold" Example: 暑いと、アイスが食べたくなる "When it's hot, I want to eat ice cream"

children.heading: な-adjectives
children.content: 静か + だと → 静かだと "when it's quiet" 便利 + だと → 便利だと "when it's convenient" Example: 静かだと、よく眠れる "When it's quiet, I can sleep well"

children.heading: Daily Habits
children.content: 朝起きると、顔を洗う "When I wake up, I wash my face" 家に帰ると、手を洗う "When I get home, I wash my hands" 夜になると、眠くなる "When night comes, I get sleepy"

children.heading: Natural Phenomena
children.content: 太陽が出ると、明るくなる "When the sun comes out, it gets bright" 雨が降ると、道が濡れる "When it rains, the roads get wet" 風が吹くと、寒く感じる "When the wind blows, it feels cold"

children.heading: Cause-Effect
children.content: お酒を飲むと、酔う "When you drink alcohol, you get drunk" たばこを吸うと、体に悪い "When you smoke, it's bad for your body" 野菜を食べると、健康にいい "When you eat vegetables, it's good for your health"

children.heading: Example 1: Giving Directions
children.content: A: 駅はどこですか？ "Where is the station?" B: この道をまっすぐ行くと、右に見えます "When you go straight on this road, you'll see it on the right" A: どのくらいかかりますか？ "How long does it take?" B: 歩くと10分くらいです "When you walk, about 10 minutes"

children.heading: Example 2: Explaining How Things Work
children.content: A: これはどう使いますか？ "How do you use this?" B: この赤いボタンを押すと、電源が入ります "When you press this red button, the power turns on" A: 消すときは？ "When turning it off?" B: もう一度押すと、消えます "When you press it again, it turns off"

children.heading: Example 3: Habits
children.content: A: いつも朝何してる？ "What do you always do in the morning?" B: 起きると、まずコーヒーを飲む "When I wake up, I first drink coffee" A: その後は？ "After that?" B: シャワーを浴びると、出かける "When I take a shower, I go out"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using と for Volitional Actions
children.content: Wrong: 時間があると、映画を見に行く ❌ Right: 時間があったら、映画を見に行く ✓ "If I have time, I'll go watch a movie"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using Past in Result Clause
children.content: Wrong: 家に帰ると、誰もいなかった ❌ Right: 家に帰ったら、誰もいなかった ✓ "When I got home, no one was there"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using for Commands
children.content: Wrong: 終わると、教えてください ❌ Right: 終わったら、教えてください ✓ "When you finish, please let me know"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using with Suggestions
children.content: Wrong: 明日雨だと、中止にしよう ❌ Right: 明日雨だったら、中止にしよう ✓ "If it rains tomorrow, let's cancel"

children.heading: Scientific Facts
children.content: 水を0度以下にすると、凍る "When you lower water below 0 degrees, it freezes" 鉄を熱すると、膨張する "When you heat iron, it expands"

children.heading: Machine Instructions
children.content: 電源ボタンを押すと、起動する "When you press the power button, it starts up" このレバーを引くと、止まる "When you pull this lever, it stops"

children.heading: Habitual Routines
children.content: 毎朝公園に行くと、犬の散歩をしている人がいる "When I go to the park every morning, there are people walking dogs" この店に来ると、いつも同じ店員がいる "When I come to this store, the same clerk is always there"

sections.heading: と for Logical Sequence
sections.content: 1 + 1をすると、2になる "When you add 1 + 1, it becomes 2" AボタンとBボタンを同時に押すと、リセットされる "When you press A and B buttons simultaneously, it resets"

sections.heading: Nuance Differences
sections.content:
雨が降ると、濡れる (natural fact) "When it rains, you get wet" 雨が降れば、濡れる (general condition) "If it rains, you get wet" 雨が降ったら、濡れる (specific instance) "If it rains, you'll get wet"

All similar, but と emphasizes inevitability!

sections.heading: Practice Sentences
sections.content: このドアを開けると、庭に出る "When you open this door, you go out to the garden" 春になると、花粉症になる "When spring comes, I get hay fever" 甘いものを食べると、太る "When I eat sweet things, I gain weight" この薬を飲むと、眠くなる "When you take this medicine, you get sleepy" 運動すると、気分が良くなる "When I exercise, I feel better" 右に曲がると、コンビニがある "When you turn right, there's a convenience store" 6時になると、帰宅する "When it becomes 6 o'clock, I go home" このボタンを押すと、音が鳴る "When you press this button, a sound plays"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ と = dictionary form + と ✓ Automatic/inevitable results ✓ Natural phenomena and facts ✓ Habitual actions ✓ Cannot use for volitional actions ✓ Cannot use past in result clause ✓ Cannot use for commands ✓ Perfect for directions and instructions ✓ Emphasizes natural consequence

Master to-conditional - express automatic results!

Next: Nara-conditional

Related:

Ba-conditional Tara-conditional Dictionary Form
